alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 14 at 5:21AM AKST until December 15 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 9 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and result in significant drifting of snow. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This afternoon, strong northeasterly winds will begin to increase over the Kuskokwim Delta coast. Snow will begin this evening along the coast and then spread inland through Friday. For areas further inland such as Bethel, northeast winds gusting up to 30 mph may reduce visibility to one half mile at times.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
